title: CHANGE THIS TO BE THE TITLE OF YOUR POST
text:
story goes here for first chart


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(gt)
library(patchwork)
library(ggrepel)

bballhits <- read_csv("mlb_hitter_stats_1914_2024.csv") |> 
  mutate(Player=gsub("#","",Player, fixed=TRUE)) |> 
  mutate(Player=gsub("*","",Player, fixed=TRUE))

bballvalue <- read_csv("mlb_hitter_value_1914_2024.csv") |> 
  mutate(Player=gsub("#","",Player, fixed=TRUE)) |> 
  mutate(Player=gsub("*","",Player, fixed=TRUE))

royalshits <- bballhits |> 
  filter(Team == "KCR") |> 
  filter(Season > 1984) |> 
  filter(grepl("\\*6", Pos) == TRUE)

royalsvalue <- bballvalue |> 
  filter(Team == "KCR") |> 
  filter(season > 1984) |> 
  filter(grepl("\\*6", Pos) == TRUE) |> 
  mutate(PlayerSeason = paste(Player, season)) 


bobby2023 <- royalshits |> 
  filter(Player == "Bobby Witt Jr.") |> 
  filter(Season == "2023")

bobby2024 <- royalshits |> 
  filter(Player == "Bobby Witt Jr.") |> 
  filter(Season == "2024")

bobbyvalue2023 <- royalsvalue |> 
  filter(Player == "Bobby Witt Jr.") |> 
  filter(season == "2023")

bobbyvalue2024 <- royalsvalue |> 
  filter(Player == "Bobby Witt Jr.") |> 
  filter(season == "2024")

bar1 <- ggplot() +
  geom_bar(data = royalsvalue, aes(x=reorder(PlayerSeason, oWAR), weight=oWAR)) +
  geom_bar(data = bobbyvalue2023, aes(x=reorder(PlayerSeason, oWAR), weight=oWAR), fill = "darkblue") +
  geom_bar(data = bobbyvalue2024, aes(x=reorder(PlayerSeason, oWAR), weight=oWAR), fill = "darkblue") +coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    x="Player", 
    y="oWAR" 
    )

bar2 <- ggplot() +
  geom_bar(data = royalsvalue, aes(x=reorder(PlayerSeason, dWAR), weight=dWAR)) +
  geom_bar(data = bobbyvalue2023, aes(x=reorder(PlayerSeason, dWAR), weight=dWAR), fill = "darkblue") +
  geom_bar(data = bobbyvalue2024, aes(x=reorder(PlayerSeason, dWAR), weight=dWAR), fill = "darkblue") +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    x="Player", 
    y="dWAR"
    )

bar1 + bar2 + 
  plot_annotation(
    title = "This is a title and we need to tell a story with it",
    subtitle = "This is the subtitle and we need to add context to the chart here.",
    caption = "Source: Sports Reference | By Matt Waite"
  )  & 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  )









Story goes here for second chart


Code
ggplot() +
  geom_point(data = royalshits, aes(x=OBP, y=SLG)) +
  geom_point(data=bobby2023, aes(x=OBP, y=SLG), color = "#004687") +
  geom_point(data=bobby2024, aes(x=OBP, y=SLG), color = "#004687") +
  theme_minimal() +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=bobby2023,
    aes(x=OBP, y=SLG, label = Player)
  ) +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=bobby2024,
    aes(x=OBP, y=SLG, label= Player)
  ) +
  labs(
    x="On Base Pecentage", 
    y="Slugging Percentage",
    title="Nebraska was good, except where it mattered", 
    subtitle="The Huskers offense and defense, on a per play basis, were among the elite in the sport.", 
    caption="Source: Data Provider | By Your Name"
    )









story goes here for third chart


Code
othercontributions <- royalshits |> 
  select(Player, Season, BB, SB, CS, OBP) |> 
  arrange(desc(SB))

othercontributions |> 
  gt() |> 
   tab_header(
    title = "Does Nebraska have a chance to be special this season?",
    subtitle = "Amy Williams' team is near the middle of a tough conference where it matters most."
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) |>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Matt Waite  |  **Source:** wehoop: The SportsDataverse's R Package for Women's Basketball Data")
  ) |>
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=12)
     )
   )

Amy Williams' team is near the middle of a tough conference where it matters most.
